Data.kSaidInfoAC: The SAID is a unique identification number for your appliance. It is located on the bottom surface of the Air Conditioner.
Data.kConnectInfoAC: Press at same time the humidity "+" and "-" buttons
Data.kClearInfoAC: Press at same time the humidity "+" and "-" buttons
Data.kSaidInfoWasher: The SAID is a unique identification number for your appliance. On the washer, it is located below the lid or door.
Data.kClearInfoWasherDryer: Press and hold the Connect button on the panel for 30 seconds to clear the network settings.
Data.kSaidInfoDryer: The SAID is a unique identification number for your appliance. On the dryer, it is located below the lid or door.
Data.kClearInfoSmartDryer: {step} Press and hold the Smart Grid Button on the panel for 30 seconds to clear the network settings.
Data.kSaidInfoIndigo:
{step} Go to your Tools Screen 
 {step}Select WiFi 
 {step}Connect to Network 
 {step}Select Next on the Connect to Network screen 
 {step} Scan the QR code displayed
Data.kConnectInfoIndigo:
{step} Go to your Tools 
 {step}Select WiFi 
 {step}Connect to Network and hit Next
 {step}Select Manual Setup 
 {step} Select Search for Network, and follow the on screen instructions
Data.kClearInfoIndigo:
{step} Go to your Tools 
 {step} Slect WiFi 
 {step} Select the Network name that your appliance is connected to. 
 {step} Select Forget Network and confirm
Data.kSaidInfoZera: The SAID is a unique identification number for your appliance. On the food recycler, it is located in the back of the product
Data.kConnectInfoLoki: {step} Press and hold the Connect button on the panel for 1 second to clear the network settings.
Data.kSaidInfoDishwasher: The SAID is a unique identification number for your appliance. It is located inside the panel of the dishwasher door.
Data.kClearInfoDishwasher: Press and hold the Connect button on the panel for 30 seconds to clear the network settings.
Data.kSaidInfoCCDishwasher: The SAID is a unique identification number for your appliance. On the Dishwasher, it is located inside the door on the right side. Here is an example of what the label looks like.
Data.kClearInfoCCDishwasher: Press and hold the Smart Grid Button on the panel for 30 seconds to clear the network settings.
Data.kSaidInfoMicrowave: The SAID is a unique identification number for your appliance. Open the microwave and it will be found along the side of the door.
Data.kClearInfoMicrowave: Press Connect button. On the appliance keypad, press "1" twice.
Data.kSaidInfoOven: The SAID is a unique identification number for your appliance. Open the warming drawer to find it located on the bottom right  panel of the oven.
Data.kConnectInfoOven: Press Connect button. On the appliance keypad, press "1" and then press "2"
Data.kClearInfoOven: Press and hold the Connect button on the panel for 15 seconds to clear the network settings.
Data.kClearInfoZera: Press and hold the Connect Button on the panel for 30 seconds to clear the network settings.
Data.kSaidInfoLoki: The SAID is a unique identification number for your appliance. Please see image to locate the position of your SAID.
Data.kClearInfoLoki: Press and hold the Connect button on the panel for 1 second to clear the network settings.
Data.kSaidInfo3XRefrigerator: The SAID is a unique identification number for your appliance. On the Refrigerator, it is located on top of the interior refrigerator control settings on the right-hand side. Here is an example of what the label looks like.
Data.kConnectInfo3XRefrigerator: An indicator light on the router will begin blinking, this means the router is looking for other devices to connect to. Within 2 minutes, press and hold [Cubed Ice] and [Crushed Ice] buttons together for 3 seconds on dispenser display.

Data.Shared.ConnectMsgs.Error_accountLocked.D: Your account is locked due to too many failed login attempts. To unlock the account, please reset your password.
Data.Shared.ConnectMsgs.Error_alreadyAddedApp: This appliance has already been successfully added to your account.
Data.Shared.ConnectMsgs.Error_alreadyClaimedA: This appliance has already been registered by another account. To register this appliance to your account instead, please contact our consumer support team.
Data.Shared.ConnectMsgs.Error_alreadyClaimedL: This address is already registered to an account. For further assistance, or if you believe this was a mistake, please contact customer support.
Data.Shared.ConnectMsgs.Error_alreadyRegister: An account already exists for %s, please make sure you have entered the correct information. If this member has created a unique account in error, they may delete their account from their account settings.
Data.Shared.ConnectMsgs.Error_applianceOfflin: %s is not communicating.  This could be caused by changing routers, router names or passwords, or if your home connection to the internet is down.
Data.Shared.ConnectMsgs.Error_applianceWrongC: Your appliance is not yet communicating. To continue, press the Connect button on your appliance and repeat the scan.
Data.Shared.ConnectMsgs.Error_checkFirewall.D: We have connected to your router, but are unable to connect to our server on the internet. Please try again or contact Customer Support for further assistance.
Data.Shared.ConnectMsgs.Error_connection.Desc: We are unable to establish a connection to your network. Please make sure you have entered the correct password and try again, or call Customer Support for further assistance.
Data.Shared.ConnectMsgs.Error_deviceNotOnBlue: To begin connecting your appliance, Bluetooth should be enabled. Please enable it in your phone's settings to continue.
Data.Shared.ConnectMsgs.Error_deviceNotOnWifi:
In order to continue adding the appliance, please make sure this device is connected to the Wi-Fi network you wish to use for your appliance.

 Check that your router supports 2.4 GHz networks.
Data.Shared.ConnectMsgs.Error_incompatibleRou: You are currently connected to a 5 GHz wireless network. This appliance only supports 2.4 GHz networks. Select a 2.4 GHz network from the prior screen.  Or, configure your router to support this band.
Data.Shared.ConnectMsgs.Error_OSoutOfDate.Des: It appears your phone's operating system needs an update. To make connecting your appliance easier, we suggest you download the update before continuing.
Data.Shared.ConnectMsgs.Error_wrongCodeEntere: An incorrect SAID code was entered.  Please check that the characters match and try again.
Data.Shared.ConnectMsgs.Error_wrongCodeScanne: An incorrect QR code was scanned.  Please make sure you scan the code that looks like the example below.

Data.Shared.HelpTopics.App_Connect_connectOnA: You will need to follow these steps on your appliance.
Data.Shared.HelpTopics.App_Connect_HelpQRcode: An example QR code is shown below; look for the real sticker typically found inside the door or lid.  If you need additional help, select an option below.
Data.Shared.HelpTopics.App_Connect_manualConn: Perform the following steps, then return to the Whirlpool app.
1. Open your Wi-Fi settings on this mobile device.
2. Look for network named similarly to WP_11_22_33_44 (the exact number should match the the 'MAC ID' printed on sticker inside your appliance).
When you have found the network, come back to this app and press NEXT.
Data.Shared.HelpTopics.App_Connect_manualIP.D: On your mobile device, follow these instructions:
Data.Shared.HelpTopics.App_Connect_manualIP.S: 1. Open a web browser. Go to the address 192.168.10.1. Enter your network credentials into the web page.
2. Reconnect your device to your phone network. Return to the Wi-Fi settings on your personal device and reconnect it to your home Wi-Fi network.
Data.Shared.HelpTopics.App_Connect_prepForCon: To connect with appliance, ensure that Wi-Fi and Bluetooth are enabled on your phone.
1. Make sure your phone is connected to a 2.4 GHz Wi-Fi band.
2. Make sure your phone has Bluetooth turned on.
Data.Shared.HelpTopics.App_Connect_reconnectA: To begin reconnecting, make sure you are in the vicinity of your appliance and follow the instructions listed below.
1. On your appliance, press and hold the Connect button for 15 seconds.
2. Once the light begins flashing, release the Connect button.
Data.Shared.HelpTopics.App_Connect_SAID.Step1: Back in the network settings on your device, connect try to connect to the network you just found. The network password will be the SAID. If you’d like you can copy the SAID to the clipboard and paste it into the password field.
Data.Shared.HelpTopics.App_Connect_SAID.Title: Connect to Wi-Fi
Data.Shared.HelpTopics.App_Connect_WPS.Descri: These steps will need to be followed on your appliance.
1. Hit next on the Connect to Network screen on your appliance.
2. Select the WPS Push button on the screen before you.
